{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-254-05-A |Item_parent=Nutritional needs of pregnant women |Item_parent_short=Nutritional needs of pregnant women |Rank=A |Title=Knowing how to prevent iron, vitamin D and calcium deficiency |Description=None |Rubric=Management |Contributors= |Order=5}} == Iron deficiency == The French National Authority for Health (HAS) recommends supplementation (with 50 mg of iron metal per day) only for patients with anaemia proven by CBC (Hb < 11 g/dL in the 1st and 2nd trimester, Hb < 10.5 g/dL in the 3rd trimester) or a low ferritin level (< 12 μg/dL).
== '''Vitamin D and calcium deficiency''' == Vitamin D supplementation is systematically recommended at the end of the 2nd trimester (100,000 IU per os in a single dose). Intakes of > 1000 mg of calcium per day are recommended during pregnancy. This corresponds to the consumption of 3 to 4 dairy products per day.
